required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 14, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of 2 Ventilatory Support Strategies During Coronavirus Disease 2019 (Covid-19) Pneumonia
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of 2 Ventilatory Support Strategies in Patients With Covid-19 Pneumonia Admitted in ICU : Retrospective Monocentric Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Centre Hospitalier Intercommunal de Toulon La Seyne sur Mer

clinical_study.source: Centre Hospitalier Intercommunal de Toulon La Seyne sur Mer

brief_summary.textblock: This retrospective monocentric study compares 2 ventilatory support strategies on outcomes (length of stay, intubation, mortality) in patients admitted in Intensive Care Unit with Covid-19 related pneumonia : invasive strategy used during the first period and non-invasive strategies (Continuous Positive Airway Pressure, High Flow Nasal Canula, Prone Position) used during the second period.

primary_outcome.time_frame: At the moment of ICU discharge or death, up to 3 month
primary_outcome.description: Number of days spent in ICU

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the moment of ICU discharge or death, up to 3 month
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of patients alive at the moment of intensive care unit discharge

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the moment of ICU discharge or death, up to 3 month
secondary_outcome.description: Number of complications during intensive care unit stay

arm_group.description: Patients admitted in ICU with Covid-19 related pneumonia during COVID19 first period.
Patients admitted in ICU with Covid-19 related pneumonia during COVID19 second period.

intervention.description: Use of an invasive ventilatory support strategy
Use of non-invasive ventilatory support strategies

study_pop.textblock: Patients with COVID 19 acute hypoxemic respiratory failure admitted in Hospital Sainte Musse ICU in 2020

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient with confirmed SARS COV2 infection
- Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome
Exclusion Criteria:
- Intensive Care Unit admission for extra pulmonary failure
- "Do Not Reanimated" order
- Patient from another Intensive Care Unit

overall_official.affiliation: Centre Hospitalier Intercommunal Toulon La Seyne sur Mer
